there i should not be afraid to leave herbert with one , while the other three went to search the forests of the island .

at this period of the year , when the trees were dried up by a tropical heat , the forest caught fire instantaneously , in such a manner that the conflagration extended itself both by the trunks of the trees and by their higher branches , whose interlacement favored its progress .

what a sad and fearful sight , and how painful to the colonists , who , from a fertile domain covered with forests , irrigated by watercourses , and enriched by the produce of their toils , found themselves , as it were , transported to a desolate rock , upon which , but for their reserves of provisions , they could not even gather the means of subsistence !
the forests of the island were in full leaf , and the time was approaching when the usual crops ought to be gathered .
as to the forest , including jacamar wood , as well as the forests of the far west , it extended as far as the eye could reach .
she went into the house ; i stayed behind a few minutes to plant in my garden a handful of roots i had dug up in the forest , and which i feared would wither if i left them till the morning .
in the meanwhile , herbert , pencroft , and the reporter occupied themselves with making traps on prospect heights and at the border of the forest .
neb and pencroft carried the corpses of the convicts into the forest , some distance from the corral , and buried them deep in the ground .
are we to leave them to overrun our forests , our fields , our plantations ?

neb , herbert , and the sailor were to return to the forest , renew their store of wood , and lay violent hands on every creature , feathered or hairy , which might come within their reach .
" it remains to be seen , " i said , " whether these forests do contain game , and if the types of game are n't of such size that they can hunt the hunter . "
this time , the hunters , instead of following the course of the river , plunged straight into the heart of the forest .
cyrus harding advised them to be very careful , as the forest probably enclosed many dangerous beasts .
even the couroucous were invisible , and it was probable that the sailor would be obliged to return to the marshy part of the forest , in which he had so happily performed his grouse fishing .

arrived at the forest , pencroft broke from the first tree two stout branches which he transformed into clubs , the ends of which herbert rubbed smooth on a rock .
while exchanging this chitchat , we entered beneath the dark canopies of the forest , and for two hours we explored it in every direction .
all was white , from the summit of mount franklin to the shore , the forests , the plains , the lake , the river .
the forest here was composed for the most part of trees which had already been met with near the lake and on prospect heights .

then all his suspicions were confirmed ; the road by which the carriage had disappeared encircled the forest .
as to the damage caused by the storm in the forest , that could not as yet be ascertained ; they would have to wait till the snowy covering was dissipated .
it is needless to add that this forest , as well as the coast already surveyed , was destitute of any sign of human life .

cyrus harding resolved then to try him , by transporting him to another scene , from that ocean which formerly his eyes had been accustomed to contemplate , to the border of the forest , which might perhaps recall those where so many years of his life had been passed !
between the forest and this accursed spot , a little behind the trampled ground , was the same track of small feet as in the garden ; the carriage had stopped here .

several excursions were made into the jacamar wood and the forests of the far west , and they brought back from thence a large collection of wild vegetables , spinach , cress , radishes , and turnips , which careful culture would soon improve , and which would temper the regimen on which the settlers had till then subsisted .
this necessitated several excursions into the forest , and they found that a great number of trees had been blown down by the last hurricane .

we went swiftly down the mountain . once past the petrified forest , i could see the nautilus 's beacon twinkling like a star . the captain walked straight toward it , and we were back on board just as the first glimmers of dawn were whitening the surface of the ocean .

and , indeed , the poor creature was on the point of springing into the creek which separated him from the forest , and his legs were bent for an instant as if for a spring , but almost immediately he stepped back , half sank down , and a large tear fell from his eyes .
they employed the day in interring the dead , who were dragged to the forest of the far west , and there buried deep .
it was only during the preceding night that the convicts had appeared on the edge of the forest , at the approaches to creek glycerine .
a river there was called the mercy , a mountain took the name of mount franklin , a small lake was named lake grant , and the forests became the forests of the far west .
the forest reached the shore , and the tall trees bending over the water were beaten by the waves .
it is useless to say that the orang was now thoroughly domesticated at granite house , and that he often accompanied his masters to the forest without showing any wish to leave them .

among the last trees of the forest of the far west , the boy found several thick clumps of bamboos .
the ice melted , the snow disappeared ; the shore , the plateau , the banks of the mercy , the forest , again became practicable .

before the cold season should appear the most assiduous care was given to the cultivation of the wild plants which had been transplanted from the forest to prospect heights .
following pencroft 's advice , it appeared best to take the road already traversed through the forest , and to return by another route .
the path , already trodden under the evergreen trees , was found , and at nine o'clock cyrus harding and his companions had reached the western border of the forest .
on leaving the forest , the mountain system of the country appeared before the explorers .
the forest of the far west supplied the best oaks and elms .
without standing up , we stared in the direction of the forest , my hand stopping halfway to my mouth , ned land 's completing its assignment .

above the forest were passing large clouds , to which the crater of mount franklin incessantly added fuliginous matter .
the island was displayed under their eyes , like a plan in relief with different tints , green for the forests , yellow for the sand , blue for the water .
the night passed without incident , and on the next day , the 15th of february , the journey through the forest , tedious rather than difficult , was continued .
the reporter never left the engineer except to hunt with herbert , for it would not have been prudent to allow the lad to ramble alone in the forest ; and it was very necessary to be on their guard .

they were now outside the forest , at the beginning of the powerful spurs which supported mount franklin towards the west .

from this point its course was pursued through a forest of magnificent trees . these trees still retained their verdure , notwithstanding the advanced season , for they belonged to the family of " coniferae , " which is spread over all the regions of the globe , from northern climates to the tropics .
they ascended the left bank of the mercy , reached the plateau , passed the bridge over creek glycerine , and advanced through the forest .

the gates were closed , and the animals had not been able to disperse in the forest .

exactly two hundred feet behind the angle formed by the river , the wall , terminated by a fall of rocks , died away in a gentle slope to the edge of the forest .

there was no vegetation on this sharp promontory , which projected two miles from the forest , and it thus represented a giant 's arm stretched out from a leafy sleeve .
" it 's the forest of crespo island , " i thought ; and i was not mistaken .
the colonists remained , therefore , near the cart , and carefully watched the neighboring parts of the forest .

we had finally arrived on the outskirts of this forest , surely one of the finest in captain nemo 's immense domains . he regarded it as his own and had laid the same claim to it that , in the first days of the world , the first men had to their forests on land . besides , who else could dispute his ownership of this underwater property ? what other , bolder pioneer would come , ax in hand , to clear away its dark underbrush ?

this forest was made up of big treelike plants , and when we entered beneath their huge arches , my eyes were instantly struck by the unique arrangement of their branches -- an arrangement that i had never before encountered .

captain nemo continued to plummet into the dark depths of this forest , whose shrubbery grew ever more sparse . i observed that vegetable life was disappearing more quickly than animal life . the open - sea plants had already left behind the increasingly arid seafloor , where a prodigious number of animals were still swarming : zoophytes , articulates , mollusks , and fish .
herbert accordingly took the path which led towards the cultivated part of the islet , while the sailor and the reporter entered the forest .

at this locality we stood in the center of a huge clearing surrounded by the tall tree forms of this underwater forest . our lamps cast a sort of brilliant twilight over the area , making inordinately long shadows on the seafloor . past the boundaries of the clearing , the darkness deepened again , relieved only by little sparkles given off by the sharp crests of coral .
then the funeral party went back up the path to the nautilus , returning beneath the arches of the forest , through the thickets , along the coral bushes , going steadily higher .
to the fuel which was so abundantly supplied by the forest , they added several cartloads of coal , which had to be brought from the foot of the spurs of mount franklin .

i sat in the dingy box absolutely enthralled . i forgot that i was in london and in the nineteenth century . i was away with my love in a forest that no man had ever seen . after the performance was over , i went behind and spoke to her . as we were sitting together , suddenly there came into her eyes a look that i had never seen there before . my lips moved towards hers . we kissed each other . i ca n't describe to you what i felt at that moment . it seemed to me that all my life had been narrowed to one perfect point of rose - coloured joy . she trembled all over and shook like a white narcissus . then she flung herself on her knees and kissed my hands . i feel that i should not tell you all this , but i ca n't help it . of course , our engagement is a dead secret . she has not even told her own mother . i do n't know what my guardians will say . lord radley is sure to be furious . i do n't care . i shall be of age in less than a year , and then i can do what i like . i have been right , basil , have n't i , to take my love out of poetry and to find my wife in shakespeare 's plays ? lips that shakespeare taught to speak have whispered their secret in my ear . i have had the arms of rosalind around me , and kissed juliet on the mouth . "

there was a grass - grown track descending the forest aisle between hoar and knotty shafts and under branched arches .

the panorama of the islands , as they steamed by them , was superb . vast forests of palms , arecs , bamboo , teakwood , of the gigantic mimosa , and tree - like ferns covered the foreground , while behind , the graceful outlines of the mountains were traced against the sky ; and along the coasts swarmed by thousands the precious swallows whose nests furnish a luxurious dish to the tables of the celestial empire . the varied landscape afforded by the andaman islands was soon passed , however , and the rangoon rapidly approached the straits of malacca , which gave access to the china seas .
the sulphur spring not being of any actual use to the settlers , they proceeded towards the thick border of the forest , which began some hundred paces off .

the bent whalebones , imprisoned in a case of ice , and covered with a thick outer layer of fat , were placed on the border of the forest at a spot where animals usually passed on their way to the lake .
all this portion of the forest was on fire , and enormous wreaths of smoke rolled over the trees , whose trunks were already consumed by the lava .
